author: Special Correspondents
text:
A total of 24,306 candidates turned up for the VAO exam conducted by Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) at 111 centres in Erode, Bhavani, Gobi, Perundurai, and Sathyamangalam divisions on Sunday.

According to official sources, 9,247 out of 33553 applicants were absent. Twenty-four officials in the rank of Deputy Tahsildars were entrusted with distribution of question papers, and teams led by 16 Deputy Tahsildars functioned as flying squads.

Accompanied by the District Collector S. Prabakar and District Revenue Officer R. Sathish, TNPSC Member Krishnakumar inspected the centre at Kumalankuttai Government Higher Secondary School. The District Collector inspected the centre at Sengunthar Higher Secondary School.

In Salem, a total of 41,937 candidates appeared for the examination held in 191 centres across the district. A total of 56,320 candidates had applied for the examination, of which 14,383 (25.5 per cent) did not appear, according to official sources.

Tight security arrangements were made at all the examination centres and the exam process was videographed.

R. Sukumar, Revenue Divisional Officer, and C. Vijaybabu, Revenue Divisional Officer, visited the Sona College of Technology centre in the city and monitored the conduct of the exam. In Namakkal district, hundreds of candidates appeared for the examination in 73 centres.

title: 24,306 candidates sit for VAO exam in Erode
